com.igeekinc.util

Class FilePath

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.igeekinc.util.FilePath
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LinuxFilePath, MacOSXFilePath, WindowsFilePath

    public abstract class FilePath
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    FilePath is an alternative to a String for representing a path to a File. FilePath encapsulates the routines necessary to parse and work with file paths. FilePath does not directly connect to file object and does not have any connection to meta data, etc. FilePaths are immutable. The conversion from a String to a FilePath involves a certain amount of parsing. Null components (i.e. "//") will be collapsed. Up tokens ("..") will be removed if normalization is on (default). Component 0 of an absolute FilePath is the root name. On Unix and Unix like systems (Linux, Mac OS X) this will be an empty string On systems such as Windows and Mac OS Classic this will be the name of the volume (e.g. C:) * @author David Smith-Uchida
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public FilePath subpath(int startPos,
               int endPos)
        Works similarly to String.substring except instead of characters our units are path components. startPos indicates the component num to start at and endPos is last component num + 1.
